alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Coastal Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued May 17 at 6:55PM EDT until May 17 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Statement, up to one half foot of inundation above ground level along shorelines and tidal waterways (6.8 to 7.0 feet Mean Lower Low Water at Charleston). For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...Coastal Colleton and Charleston Counties. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Statement, until 9 PM EDT this evening. For the High Rip Current Risk, from Thursday morning through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...This could result in some roads becoming impassable. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide will occur around 7:24 PM today at Charleston. Saltwater inundation will be possible 1 to 2 hours before and after high tide. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Charleston Harbor SC MLLW Categories - Minor 7.0 ft, Moderate 7.5 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.2 ft, Moderate 1.7 ft, Major 2.2 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 17/07 PM 7.0 1.2 0.7 N/A Minor 18/08 AM 6.4 0.6 1.1 N/A None 18/08 PM 7.6 1.8 1.1 N/A Moderate 19/08 AM 6.1 0.3 1.1 N/A None 19/09 PM 7.1 1.3 0.7 N/A Minor &&
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
